etymologies: Old English fiscere ‘fisherman’, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch visser and German Fischer, also to fish

definitions: a person who catches fish for a living or for sport

examples.text: he was an enthusiastic fisher and hunter
an experienced trout fisher will be on hand to guide and advise

definitions: a large brown marten valued for its fur, found in North American woodland where it frequently preys on porcupines.
shortDefinitions: large brown marten valued for its fur, found in North American woodland where it frequently preys on porcupines
